alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 09 at 6:19AM MST until November 09 at 12:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Winter Storm On Tap... .Areas of freezing drizzle are expected this morning. A winter storm will then move from the Rockies into the northern Plains through Thursday. It will spread a swath of precipitation into northeastern Wyoming and western South Dakota. Mostly snow is expected over northeastern Wyoming, the Black Hills and northwestern South Dakota. Freezing rain will occur east of the Black Hills tonight, but will change to snow overnight. Gusty northerly winds will develop late tonight into Thursday which will create areas of blowing snow and greatly reduced visibilities where accumulating snow falls. Monitor NOAA Weather Radio for the latest information, forecasts, and warnings. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, expect areas of freezing drizzle this morning. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County and Western Crook County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until noon MST today. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow will reduce visibilities at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
